pronunciation: BETROTH', [be and troth, truth, faith. See Truth, and Troth.]

definitions.text:
1. To contract to any one, in order to future marriage; to promise or pledge one to the future spouse of another; to affiance; used of either sex. 'The father betroths his daughter.'
2. To contract with one for future spouse; to espouse; as, man betroths lady.
3. To nominate to bishopric, in order to consecration.
